titleInfo.title: Bas-relief de Rameses II trouvé à Sakkara. Egypte.

mods.abstract: Relief of God Heh (Old Kingdom), plaster copy at the Gizeh Museum; the God Heh in traditional crouching stance in three quarter view holding palm stems in both hands wearing palm frond headdress in niche on relief; stylized cartouches of Rameses II (?) (top left and right corners of niche); framed by rows of uraei (top and bottom); "Bonfils 203 Bas-relief de Rameses II trouve a Sakkara-Egypt" in white along bottom of print; "L. KUHN, editeur 20. Rue de Rivoli. PARIS" impressed onto print, bottom right corner.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
